titleStmt.title: Linköping Diocesan Library, Kl f 2
titleStmt.sponsor: Greek manuscripts in Sweden – a digitization and cataloguing project

publicationStmt.publisher: Manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Manuscripts in Sweden

supportDesc.foliation: Pagination in ink by the scribe in the upper right margin from onwards: 4–83

p.note: A shelfmark label on pastedown and a dedication note on . carries the half title: ΑΝΑΚΡΕΟΝΤΟΣ ΟΔΑΙ.

binding.p: Red morocco over thin cardboard, gilt tooled beaded border on covers; smooth spine with ample gilding (lines and plumes, or perhaps corn ears). Spine title reads NACRE. The current shelfmark glued on spine paper label at tail. Two coloured paper bifolia serve as endleaves at front and end: the blue ones are pasted onto a guard of white paper, whereas the pink ones are used as pastedowns and are pasted onto the blue.

history.provenance: The volume is in all likelyhood copied after a printed model during Carl Valdemar Enelius’s time of study in Uppsala (cf. : ad optimorum exemplarium fidem scripsit. His name is present in the membership record for Östgöta nation in the year . Born in Dalhem, Östergötland, in 1791, as the vicar’s son. After his university studies, he had for some years a career as Secretary of the Royal Majesty’s Registry and official at the Court of Appeal. Later he returned to his childhood province and engaged in husbandry. Died in 1858.
history.acquisition: Donated to the Gymnasium Library in ; cf. dedication on . The Gymnasium Library and the Diocese Library have a mutual past and are nowadays administered by the municipal library in Linköping.

p.note: Two types of paper: a thicker bluish paper, similar to that of the flyleaves; (plus title leaves and guards) white, homogeneous.

collation.p: A guard precedes the first bifolium (i.e. the title leaves), and another guard follows after the end of the textblock, both pasted onto the closest page and used in the endleaf construction; cf. binding description.

layout.note: The text is written at the centre of the page in short, spacious lines.

handDesc.handNote: Carl Valdemar Enelius writing a fine and elegant Greek script, vertically developed and inclined to the right.

decoDesc.p: The half title page, the title vignette at the beginning of the text, and the vignette at the end of the text are penflourished with finely drawn geometrical and flowery designs, among which the title, ΑΝΑΚΡΕΟΝΤΟΣ ΟΔΑΙ, is written. A particular ornamental motif is constituted by thin arrows that dart across the design, some more pointedly through bow-shaped object, an allusion to the amorous tone of the poetry contained in this dainty book.

history.origin: Written in Uppsala , in 1809 by Carl Valdemar Enelius; the date 09 and the initials CWE are present on the title page.

revisionDesc.change: Changing status from draft to published
